availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse Barlow (Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Leason Barlow and Nancy Barlow. Married to Elizabeth Ishmael Barlow in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on November 26, 1855. Father of Sarah Barlow, James Barlow, Samuel Barlow, Mary A. Barlow, and Morgan Barlow. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1850. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1860. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1863. Served as a private in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from September 27, 1863 to November 20, 1864. Died of disease in Lexington, Kentucky, on November 20, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District, p. 413B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 1, p. 315.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Precinct 2, p. 212A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Nicholas County, KY, July 1863, p. 4.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0495.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film 000252409.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 438.
